data.title: Tony Henman obituary: composed and supportive father of Wimbledon favourite
data.meta_description: Solicitor and all-round amateur sportsman whose presence in the players’ box became a fixture of his son’s classic Centre Court battles
data.text:
As Tony Henman proudly led his bride down the aisle, the guests gazed in amazement. The young solicitor’s normally smooth, clean-cut face was disfigured by two black eyes and a painful-looking broken nose, injuries sustained not from a pub brawl but from a fiercely struck ball during a scrimmage in a county hockey match. Even the couple’s winter honeymoon in Devon was not immune from the groom’s passion for ball games as he cut it short by a couple of days to play hockey for Oxford Town in a local derby match.

Fortunately, his new wife Jane (née Billington) was more understanding than most; her own family were equally devoted to sport, particularly horse breeding and tennis.

The couple’s youngest son, Tim, a longtime British
